content:
(4) "Bis as recipient" Besides to replace PIO/C itous, the principal objective of this project has been to improve the quality and speed of construction work under aid pro- jects. BES in fact is the only construction enterprise here using large quantities of heavy construction equip- mert and has continuously undertaken construction work under sid projects. Hence, BES is eligible recipient and has been Listed as such under Project Agreements. The first batch of excess equipment from Japan was chosen on the spot by DES jointly with Mission/J.G.white person- nel and Has was the biggest recipient during the early stage of this project, in 1959 and 1960. So further request of excess equipment for bus was made by the end of last year at the suggestion of Program office of Mission and in view of the fact that equipment possessed by DES were about enough to meet their basedisto requirement s.
(5) "Detailed Arrival Report." The detallod Arrival Report is now submitted by Bis withan about two weeks from the date of arrival. Considering tre various stops necessary at the port and time rammired by bas for checking and listing, we think this is reasonable. The welders, parts and tanks referred to in r/ata mano of 2/26/62 were allocated to ZPU end Hill on March 5, 1962, part of the welders being later reallocated to SOC.
Copy each of CUSA Lafest correspondence with PO of mission (03-62-0742) 63-2-4918, 62-62-1317) is attached herewith for your reference.
Draft Audit Report No. 1-1711, uncleared, is also returned herewith.
Bncl. draft audit report copies of Gusi letters to FO ce: ID US AID/C (with copies of CusA letter to PO) PO US AID/G - 1 Biss, 40, 40 # R 20, 39

paragraphs.content: (4) "Bis as recipient" Besides to replace PIO/C itous, the principal objective of this project has been to improve the quality and speed of construction work under aid pro- jects. BES in fact is the only construction enterprise here using large quantities of heavy construction equip- mert and has continuously undertaken construction work under sid projects. Hence, BES is eligible recipient and has been Listed as such under Project Agreements. The first batch of excess equipment from Japan was chosen on the spot by DES jointly with Mission/J.G.white person- nel and Has was the biggest recipient during the early stage of this project, in 1959 and 1960. So further request of excess equipment for bus was made by the end of last year at the suggestion of Program office of Mission and in view of the fact that equipment possessed by DES were about enough to meet their basedisto requirement s.

(5) "Detailed Arrival Report." The detallod Arrival Report is now submitted by Bis withan about two weeks from the date of arrival. Considering tre various stops necessary at the port and time rammired by bas for checking and listing, we think this is reasonable. The welders, parts and tanks referred to in r/ata mano of 2/26/62 were allocated to ZPU end Hill on March 5, 1962, part of the welders being later reallocated to SOC.
Copy each of CUSA Lafest correspondence with PO of mission (03-62-0742) 63-2-4918, 62-62-1317) is attached herewith for your reference.
